Class Hangman

  • java.lang.Object
    • Hangman

  • public class Hangman
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    1.0

    Hangman is a GUI program that allows the user to input a word to be guessed. The user will then be able to see the GUI with the buttons to guess a letter. A graphic to show an animation of hangman. The guessed letters and the number of guesses left before the game is over. At the very top is the word that will have blanks to show the letters missing and it will be updated for each guess populating the word slowly as the game progresses. At the end of the game message boxes will show when the game is lost or won. If lost the word will also be displayed to show the correct answer.

    Author:
    Alex Wong wong4a@gmail.com

      This ButtonHandler class will implement the ActionListener.
      private class  Hangman.DrawHangman
      This DrawHangman class extends JPanel which will be used to inherit the paintComponent which will be overridden to draw the Hangman graphic.

    • Field Detail

      • word

        private java.lang.String word
        This is the word that needs to be guessed.

      • usedletters

        private java.lang.String usedletters
        This is the String of letters that are used. This will update for each guess populating it with letters. These are non-separated. Ex. ARCLEFG...

      • guessesleft

        private int guessesleft
        This is the number of guesses left. As it progresses this will increment down to zero.

      • guessedletters

        private int guessedletters
        This is the number of unique letters that have been guessed.

      • displayword

        private javax.swing.JLabel[] displayword
        This is an array of JLabels of each character in the word to be guessed. This is because we want to have spaces between each character.

      • displayusedletters

        private javax.swing.JLabel[] displayusedletters
        This is an array of JLabels of each character that is guessed.

      • displayguessesleft

        private javax.swing.JLabel displayguessesleft
        This is the JLabel for the number of guesses left.

      • wordpanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel wordpanel
        This is the JPanel for where the word to be guessed. This panel will be placed at the very top of the frame.

      • buttonpanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel buttonpanel
        This is the JPanel for where the buttons will be placed in a grid layout format. The buttons will be at the bottom of the frame.

      • guessedletterspanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel guessedletterspanel
        This is the JPanel for where the letters guessed will be placed. This will be placed on the center left of the frame.

      • guessesleftpanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel guessesleftpanel
        This is the JPanel for where the number of guesses left will be placed. This will be placed on the center right of the frame.

      • h1

        private Hangman.DrawHangman h1
        This is the graphic panel of the Hangman drawing using paint component.

    • Method Detail

      • getWord

        public java.lang.String getWord()
        This is to get the word that needs to be guessed.
        Returns:
        string of the word that needs to be guessed.

      • getUsedletters

        public java.lang.String getUsedletters()
        This is to get the letters that have been used by the user.
        Returns:
        string of the letters used

      • getGuessesleft

        public int getGuessesleft()
        This will get the number of guesses left the game has left before it ends.
        Returns:
        integer of the number of guesses that are left in the game

      • getGuessedletters

        public int getGuessedletters()
        This is will get the number of unique letters that are guessed.
        Returns:
        an integer of the number of unique letters that have been guessed in the game

      • initalsetup

        public void initalsetup(java.lang.String word)
        This will initialize the GUI. This includes the buttons panel, letters used panel, guesses left panel, word, and graphic. This will also process the word that should be guessed. This will set the panels to be aligned correctly and set also the size of the window.
        Parameters:
        word - the word that the user will need to guess in the game

      • initButtonPanel

        private void initButtonPanel()
        This will initialize the button panel creating a grid layout to place buttons for each letter of the alphabet. Also linking the actionlistener to each button with the buttonhandler. Then populating the buttons from left to right in the grid layout.

      • initLettersPanel

        private void initLettersPanel()
        This will initialize the panel for the display of the letters that are to be displayed that have been guessed by the user. This will utilize a grid layout to populate up to 26 letters. We fill the grid with blank spaces at the beginning to make sure the size of the window is to the size it needs to be without needing to resize the window again later on. This will also create a a border around the panel to make it easier for the user to understand what these letters being displayed means.

      • initWordPanel

        private void initWordPanel()
        This will initialize the panel to be used to see the word being guessed. It will start out by populating the word length with underscores to allow the user to know the number of characters that will are in the word. Also these underscores will be replaced with the correct letter once the user guesses the corresponding letter.

      • initGuessesLeftPanel

        private void initGuessesLeftPanel()
        This will initialize the panel for the number of guesses left. We will take the integer variable guessesleft and pass it as a string to JLabel to be displayed onto the JPanel.
